title: Should RIOT give us progress on our honors based on end-of-game standings if we lose a match?

replies.body: The thing with the Honour system is that it's designed around *attitude*, not *skill*. To say that players who do better at the game should progress more than players who have a positive attitude is counter-intuitive to the system. The reward for doing better than other players varies, including progressing Champion Mastery, progressing Ranked (in ranked), earning more IP (and XP if the account isn't level 30) etc. There's no need to make Honour based on skill, when the purpose of the system is rewarding consistent positive behaviour, and when there's plenty of systems rewarding skill already.

Yeaahhhh... no. The honour system is about how you are as a person, and how you behave, not how many kills and assists you get. If you remain really positive, and support players who aren't doing too well, you will get honoured eventually, even if you don't get honoured the first time.
if you did well and carried, odds are you'll get plenty of honour, your suggestion benefits toxic kda warriors. Also riot's grading system is very bad at evaluating actual performance.
